page.title: 19Educational Facilities
page.content: There are primary schools in East Hagbourne, South Moreton and Blewbury. The school in East Hagbourne is a Church of England foundation and takes children from the surrounding area outside the village including part of Didcot. Blewbury school covers the village which lies outside our area. The school at south Moreton covers approx. a 3 mile area and has made recent efforts to provide extended facilities for the school and preschool children. The village is conservation conscious and has just spent #300 on providing 26 trees for the playing field which also has a sand pit, swings and a climbing frame. There are at present 101 pupils at the school, divided into 4 classes with 5 staff (two are part time). From here pupils go to St. Birinus or Didcot Girls School, Didcot or Wallingford School
